result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Danielle M Bilgrien

records.addlTxt: Received and Filed. DPA Supervision Report 11.4.22

Defendant Danielle M Bilgrien appeared by video.  Attorney Dawn Rablin appeared in court on behalf of Helmi Hamad for Danielle M Bilgrien.  Prosecuting attorney David T. Malone in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Case in court for Review Hearing. Defendant is experiencing connection issues. Court orders case adjourned for an additional review hearing before Br 17.
Review hearing scheduled for November 7, 2022 at 10:15 am.
Received and Filed. DPA Supervision Report 10.17.22

Defendant Danielle M Bilgrien in court.  Attorney Helmi Hamad in court for Danielle M Bilgrien.  Prosecuting attorney Brad Alan Vorpahl in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Case in court for a review hearing. Court addressed the JusticePoint violation. Court IMPOSES AND STAYS a 2 day JAIL SANCTION. Court orders defendant to complete the intake reassessment with Dewy. Court orders defendant to participate in a daily community support group. Court orders defendant to keep a log of the daily community support groups and submit the log to the defendants monitor. Case adjourned to Branch 17.
Review hearing scheduled for October 17, 2022 at 02:45 pm.
Received and Filed. DPA Supervision Report 10.10.22
Received and Filed. DPA Violation Report 9.30.2022

Defendant Danielle M Bilgrien in court.  Attorney Helmi Hamad in court for Danielle M Bilgrien.  Prosecuting attorney Brad Alan Vorpahl in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Defendant is in compliance with the agreement. Defendant needs to complete the community service hours and attend office contacts in order to receive the benefits of the agreement. Case adjourned to Branch 17.
Review hearing scheduled for October 11, 2022 at 02:30 pm.
Received and Filed. DPA Supervision Report 8.26.2022

Defendant Danielle M Bilgrien in court with attorney Helmi Hamad.  Brad Alan Vorpahl appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Court is in receipt of violation reports from JusticePoint. Court held collquy with the defendant. Case is scheduled for review hearing on August 29th, 2022 at 3:50 pm.
Received and Filed. DPA 8/16/22 Violation Report

Defendant Danielle M Bilgrien in court with attorney Helmi Hamad.  David T. Malone appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
4 out of 5 office contacts made. Essay and letter of apology has been completed. Community serivce needs to be completed. Defendant needs to continue testing negative, complete community service and complete IOP in order to receive the full benefits of the agreement. Case adjourned to Branch 21.
  Pursuant to Chief Judge Directive 22-04, parties are hereby notified that effective July 30, 2022 this case will be assigned to branch 17, Judge Carolina Stark, in Room 400 of the Courthouse.  Review hearing scheduled for August 29, 2022 at 03:50 pm.
Received and Filed. DPA Supervision Report 7.8.2022
Received and Filed. DPA Violation 7.1.22. Court will address at the next court date.

Defendant Danielle M Bilgrien (via Zoom) in court with attorney Helmi Hamad.  David T. Malone appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: AMI
Report reviewed. Violations addressed. Defendant needs to test negative in order to receive the benefit of this agreement. Defendant is attending treatment. Defendant is employed and attended all office contacts. Defendant needs to complete community service. Court held colloquy with the defendant.   Based upon the defendant's compliance with the Deferred Prosecution Agreement, matter is adjourned for Final Hearing in Branch 21.  Review hearing scheduled for July 11, 2022 at 09:50 am.
Received and Filed, DPA Supervision Report 6.13.22

Received, Filed, and Forwarded to the Judge for review; 6.3.22 Violation
Court will address at the next court date.
Received and Filed, DPA Letter of Apology
Received and Filed, DPA Essay 5.18.22
Per parties request, case adjourned for Review Hearing in Branch 21. New date selected via email with parties.
Received and Filed, DPA Supervision Report 4.12.22

As a condition of bail, court order the defendant may not possess dangerous weapons or firearms or apply for a conceal carry permit.
Defendant advised it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.
Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Parties are prepared to enter into a deferred prosecution agreement.

Defendant was advised of constitution rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights and entered a plea of GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Stipulation by parties to complaint as a factual basis to sustain the guilty plea.  Defendant further advised that if he is not a US citizen deportation is possible.  Court found the defendant guilty as charged in the Complaint/Information.  Court WITHHELD entry of judgment of conviction.  Deferred Prosecution Agreement received and filed.
 
Court ordered case adjourned for Review in Branch 21.

Defendant Danielle M Bilgrien in court with attorney Helmi Hamad.  David T. Malone appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Danielle M Bilgrien appeared by video means with Attorney.  Deputy Court Clerk: AMI
Case heard via Zoom. 
Case recalled at 2:14. Court warns the defendant regarding tardiness. 
  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defense waived reading and momentarily enters a plea of not guilty on behalf of client.

Attorney Helmi Hamad in court.  David T. Malone appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Attorney appeared by video means.  Deputy Court Clerk: AMI
Case heard via Zoom. Defendant does not appear. Defense request case passed to the afternoon. Case passed.  Review hearing scheduled for April 12, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
received and filed.
